response.answer_text: You never know all the effects of an election. If Bush/Gore had gone the other way maybe there would have been no 9/11, no Iraq or Afghan wars, no Barak Obama. Maybe in a few decades when we’re suffering a lot worse from climate change even than we are now, we’ll look back and say that Gore would have gotten us on track before it was too late. Maybe. But for now, I’d vote for Lincoln’s second term. In 1864 Lincoln was running against his former general George McClellan. McClellan ran initially on a platform of ending the war but not abolishing slavery. During the early part of the campaign Lincoln seemed very vulnerable. The Civil War looked like a long, bloody deadlock. A lot of Northerners didn’t want to fight for the rights of slaves and liked the idea of a compromise ending. And on the other side, a lot of people had come to the abolitionist cause and were alienated from Lincoln because he was vacillating and weak on the subject. It could have gone the other way. If it had, it is probable slavery would not have been abolished, and could even be the law to this day. But between July and September of that year General Sherman’s forces took Atlanta and victory came into sight. And in the end Lincoln won by a landslide. This year, Mr. “Best President for the blacks since Lincoln, maybe better than Lincoln” Trump is running on a Flush Democracy Down the Toilet platform. And if he wins he just might do it. I dunno if it’s the most important election in US history; if he wins a second term we’ll find out.
